entry.value: Shows how to set a shapely geometry object as the node view. It is easy to do that because shapely geometry objects implement a _repr_svg_ like many other objects.

import knime.scripting.io as knio%%00010from shapely import geometry%%00010%%00010# Create a geometry object%%00010line = geometry.LineString([(0, 0), (1, 1), (0, 2), (2, 2), (3, 1), (1, 0)])%%00010dilated = line.buffer(0.5)%%00010eroded = dilated.buffer(-0.3)%%00010%%00010# Set the geometry object as the output view%%00010# knio.view will use the _repr_svg_ function of the geometry object%%00010knio.output_view = knio.view(eroded)%%00010
